column5: I'm a LMB guy, but i'll tell you, lb for lb, the SMB i have caught this year(My first BTW) are hands down the hardest fighter of the 2.They really just want to rip the rod right outta your hands and beat the heck outta you with it

I'm heading up to my father in laws. A little lake that does not get enough pressure. Last year I caught bass after bass casting from shore. Nothing huge, but a good day. I ended up with bass thumb for the first time in my life.
I'll be with the family at a cottage on Cooch! Hopefully the bass are in the same spots as last year.
lol that's funny stuff right there!
Haliburton
pigeon

I will be at my trailer on Dalrymple so that will be the plan for Saturday, I will be off all week so I plan on hitting up Lake Muskoka and Simcoe for some smallie action and maybe Balsam and Pigeon. Got the Gambler flap`n shaps,tubes and the senko`s ready to go!!!  Bass opener is always a special day for me always has and always will be!

On the sunday I am fishing the Edu cast tourney out of turkey point marina taking a regional qualifier from the high school tourney out for some Lake Erie smallies should be lots of fun for everyone involved.
Ill be hitting up the Haliburton highlands. First Eels lake, then on to Lake Apsley and a few other smaller lakes.
huh, bass?  does it look or taste like a walleye?
Nope but they don't fight like a grocery bag either
the last one I got didn't either, I swear I had a 9LB SMB on or a mini musky.
I recently went exploring and scoped out a fabulous looking spot in Georgian Bay. Gin-clear water, all rocky, can't wait.Night have to take an extra day or two...
just think of the fun we could have if we all hooked up for a fish,good luck to all and catch your limit but limit your catch....  stay dry out there  Hawg Hunter
i'm going to spend the weekend at my family's old farmstead. it's located near some top notch back country smallie lakes and i'm fixin' to get a new PB.
long point! tryin to find a 6+ for a pb
georgian bay saturday to monday! can't wait!
Dang... looks like I'll be in Temagami, but I sure won't be fishing for bass!
Fishin in the Rain at White Lake near Arnprior
There's a season on bass...  why, never keep any and taste like  Have fun you bass chasers....less anglers fishing walleyes...
Shh, let them have the bass...
GOOD IDEA....
Lake Erie for some smallies. My parents hold a bass derby at there place every year for the family and friends. Can't wait last year I won first for 230 bucks hope I can get it again.
i'll be working....come visit me at Milne Park in Markham  i take a coffee with one milk
what about the doughnut?
nope...i gave those up cold turkey...been clean for 3 yrs lol
I prefer a cold water smally over walleyes any day smallies are great if they are 1-2lbs out of cold water
I will probably be out on Buckhorn - my go to big largie lake.

I forget what it was called I just know Jos showed me where he was going to be fishing so I told him to watch out as I would add spikes on the out side of my boards so he had better put a few extra coats of wax on his boat this week  If I am out Saturday morning I will head over to his area just to say Hi.

Found the info on the tourney and here it is .  Ed Broadwood Memorial Tournament Saturday June 25th Mitchell's Bay Marina $150 entry plus $10 big fish pool 95% payback blastoff 7:00 a.m., weigh in at 3:30 p.m  For more information contact Bill Hamilton 519-354-5869
I will be on Paudash for sure
I'll be fishing Jack's Lake in the Kawarthas as always.
fishing my lake where i live sturgeon !!! then the following week,doing the lindsay bassmasters tounament on sturgeon lake as well....oh ya  !!!
Anchored right here if I ever get around to cleaning out the "Tin of Beans" and get'er launched...
I'm thinking of a little trip to sparrow, to chase buckets!
If i get out around these Gordon Rocks or a bit south or east of there. Lots of big smallies.

I bumped into a long lost fishing buddy last year and it would be nice if we could work out a trip up to his family cottage. Private launch for cottagers only and you could fish the whole lake without starting your outboard. My other 2 times on this lake about 10 years ago were very memorable. First 3 cast I had 3 smallies on, smallest was 21". The lake is hardly fished as most cottagers are non anglers and being a smaller lake there's really only car toppers or canoes out there. South side of the lake is all rock, cliffs and shoals, top end is 1-2 miles of floating logs, duckweed, lily pads and undercut willow bushes.
I am going to concentrate on learning deep water smallies on Lake Erie this year. I have a few spots but its so big it can be intimidating, would like to break the 7 pound barrier.

Has someone already said: The same place I've been going for the last month?  Have fun, stay safe.  Bass opener doesn't hold the same appeal for me as the others.  I guess most of it has to do with the fact that I've been out on, or next to, open water for a couple of months at least by the time bass opens here.
Very nice i go north of bon echo myself .There are a few lakes for smallies  and walleye that not to many people know about  . i'll post my adventures when i get back  .
Enjoy some music while out on the water! Tragically hip is playing that weekend if you were not aware.
simcoe but I may wait till the following wednesday and have no crowds  TB
sure sounds like the openers gonna be full of adventure for many,i hope you all enjoy a great and safe day and don't forget your Buzz Baits lol  Hawg Hunter
Ditto - my plan is to whop on Dano for the derby!
If it is not too rough and windy I may be terrorizing the bass at the north end of Big Island or Hurricane Point myself (4 HP Mercury restricts things)
That stretch south to Big Island gets rough on westerly winds. My favourite fishing in Ontario all around there though.

Lake Erie for me. Been fishing the Buffalo area for a month now had some killer days can't wait to fish our side. I actually took a weeks vacation for the opener I'm off from June 22nd - July 4th.  Rob
I did not know that. Thanks very much for the info!!
channals of the Detroit river in LaSalle. tossing spinnerbaits tubes and worms
Heading to Black Donald Lake near Calabogie. Cant wait

well folks im like a kid at christmas with the count down to the Bass opener only 10 days away in my area anyway,im heading north of Bon Echo to fish 4/5 lakes with 14 other lads,can't wait ..  so where you all heading for the opener of Bass season.  Hawg Hunter
I like to go salmon fishing on bass opener.
bobcaygeon is one of my list but not sure yet...
I'll be sticking around here.  My guess is Nipissing for a mixed bag of fish.
...To a wedding.... yea, Thats right !  Hopefully I can get out in the AM before hand..... IF I can get it off work !
I will most likely be down fishing St. Clair out of Mitchell's bay.
I'm going to Pigeon. Super pumped!!! I can't wait!!!!
I'll be out sneaking around as I try get a good look at Lady Simcoe's bass.
Paudash Lake for a couples weekend, but will definitely have the boat to go after some of those smallies. I can't believe I'm leaving Pigeon Lake for Paudash, but best to make my better half happy!
looks like I am working  my boat is not working anyways
Mitchells bay for some pig LSC smallies can't wait.
White Lake near Arnprior.Been doing it for years in memory of Dad.Usually go with my Brother in his Ranger, but this year the Princecraft is gonna take me there
I'll be out on sturgeon lake for sure, can't wait to toss a frog or skip a senko
Long Point as usual
I haven't made up my mind yet will be pigeon or belmont

If I can get out with my brother, we will likely go to West Lake or Rice.  We caught tons of OOS largies when we were there a few weeks ago.  Hopefully the bass will be inthe same spots when we come back.
I think you should choose Belmont for sure...

LSC bugging the bass guys with my musky gear LOL.  Actually I was talking to Jos from Angling Outfitters he will be out on LSC for a tournament that is going on so I told him I will be running my plainer boards right by his boat as he is trying to flip for them bass.

If I still have my boat,I,ll be hitting my usual spots. Guess I cant complain. I,ll be standing on a swim platform casting tubes and spinner baits.If it gets to warm,I can take a dip. Jump back in, towel off and get at it again.  Piss,em off Mike.
What tourney is going on there that day?
I'll be laying lockstone at home.....*sigh*

I'll be fishing smallies this weekend, 7 hours north at my camp.  For all you fans of largemouth bass fishin', a video to whet your appetites.   <iframe width="425" height="349" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/vcFXdLY6Z-0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

My favorite place in the world with my kidds cousin and his bride to be along with family and childhood friends. Fishing yes but it comes in second their.  Think we will be leaving the Bass alone as there was no sign of them on the May long weekend and my 37yrs of fishing sudjest they might not be done standing gaurd. On the CANADA DAY long weekend. Either that or somthing verry bad happend to this little Bass lake. Hope not.
Mike ,a CLASSIC.
Its out of mitchells bay its $150 +$10 for big fish can't remember the namr though same one I'm fishing.
